CatDescriptText: Junious Hamlin, housewife, Homestead and Jeannette Chick, home economist, Brushton,  were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question "What are the most appealing and the least appealing aspects of Republican presidential candidate Richard M. Nixon?"  Mrs. Hamiln's answer reads: "He's my ideal and has more knowledge than Kennedy about what is going on.  One small thing I don't like is his bragging when he wins." Ms. Chick's answer reads: "The most appealing aspect he has is the fact that he is vice president of the United States.  The least is the fact that he couldn't deal successfully with Khrushchev."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Junious Hamlin wearing eyeglasses and Triumph Church sash, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Jeannette Chick wearing eyeglasses and plaid dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
